intro: Psychotria microdesmia, commonly known as the small-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria microdesmia is often found growing along stream banks and in moist, well-drained soils.
